title: Inside the hotel straight out of a 'horror film' with dirty sheets, blood on the mattress and duct tape
text:
News Inside the hotel straight out of a 'horror film' with dirty sheets, blood on the mattress and duct tape “The carpet was stained and had holes in it’ and "the light fitting was hanging off the wall", one guest said of the Scarisbrick Hotel Share The Scarisbrick Hotel has been the subject of a repeated complaints from guests (Photo: Google) Share Get   
Dirty sheets, lights fittings hanging off the wall and a window secured with duct tape, has earned one hotel the description of “like something out of a horror film”. 
Another guest simply described it as “the worst hotel ever.” 
TripAdvisor reviews written by people who have stayed at the Scarisbrick Hotel paint a less than flattering picture of the premises. 
Of its 1,557 reviews, the Britannia-owned Scarisbrick racks up an impressive 611 "terrible" reviews. 
Some have dubbed it the worst hotel in Southport. Stained sheets (Photo: Southport Visiter) Stained sheets (Photo: Southport Visiter) A window secured with tape (Photo: Southport Visiter) Damaged drawers (Photo: Southport Visiter) Dirty windows (Photo: Southport Visiter) 
The most recent review is simply entitled ‘Truly terrible’. 
Reviewer michaelabradshaw68 said: “The carpet was stained and had holes in it’ and "the light fitting was hanging off the wall". 
She goes on to say the building in Southport needs dragging into the present day, the Southport Visiter reports. Peeling paint (Photo: Southport Visiter) A damaged wall (Photo: Southport Visiter) 
Traveller photos on the review site depict peeling walls, dodgy fittings and fixtures, grubby windows, dust and things held together with duct tape - as well as blood-stained mattresses. 
The hotel, however, does have 116 ‘excellent’ reviews, the most recent of these was November 2016. The reviewer said she ‘couldn’t fault’ the hotel and she ‘had a cracking weekend’. 
According to LateRooms, a two-night stay for two next weekend (March 4-6), would set you back just £108. A dirty vent (Photo: Southport Visiter) Exposed wiring (Photo: Southport Visiter) Read More 
But is it really Southport’s worst hotel - as its Tripadvisor ranking would suggest? 
Scarisbrick is ranked 23 out of 27 Southport hotels. 
However, numbers 24-27 are no longer trading. 
The Mirror has contacted the hotel for comment. Like us on Facebook
